title: Browsershot
descriptionShort: Browser screenshots provided with a SaaS platform.
descriptionFull: This application generates, stores, and shows images taken of webpages designated by a user.  Image files are stored on the hosting platform using the Rails framework Active Storage--a feature similar to Amazon's S3 object storage service.

title: React Todo List
descriptionShort: Todo list app with dynamic features.
descriptionFull: This application is a dynamic, todo list tool.  Originally forked from a Sellpy repository, I implemented improvements that include autosaving, due dates, 'time remaining' calculator, checkbox completion, data persistence with a back-end, and client/API hosting.
Acceptance tests are scripted with the Cypress testing framework to verify features in the view.

tech.Client-side: React, NPM, Axios, Material-UI, HTML5, CSS3, Cypress

title: maxaubain.com
descriptionFull: This website is a single-page, client-side application implemented with React.

Notable features include dynamic layouts for mobile displays, routing with React Router, email messaging with the Formspree microservice, website copy is stored in JSON files and passed to React components as 'props', and a script to procedurally populate projects' 'technology' section with external links.

tech.Client-side: React, React Router, NPM, Axios, HTML5, CSS3, Formspree

title: Gnosis: Science News
descriptionFull: Gnosis was planned and constructed by a team comprising myself and five other junior developers.
The application itself is a science news aggregation site with interconnected user roles for university 'subscribers', research group 'publishers', and member 'readers'.
Please refer to the 'client-side' documentation for detailed use of the app and developer credits.

tech.Client-side: React, Redux, NPM, Axios, Semantic-UI, HTML5, CSS3, Cypress, Enzyme
tech.Server-side: Rails, Rspec, CORS, Stripe, Devise Token Auth

title: Gnosis Mobile App
descriptionFull: Browser applications can be 'repackaged' as mobile applications, for example by using the Capacitor library within the Ionic framework.
As such, the React client of Gnosis has been updated to an iOS mobile application and can be run locally using Apple's Xcode mobile app emulator.

tech.Client-side: React, Redux, NPM, Ionic, Capacitor, Axios, Semantic-UI, HTML5, CSS3
tech.Server-side: Rails, Rspec, CORS, Stripe, Devise Token Auth

title: Articles Blog
descriptionFull: This application demonstrates the Create, Read, Update, and Delete (CRUD) methods that are fundamental to RESTful APIs, in conjunction with user authentication functionality.
Please feel free to visit the live site, sign up, and leave a post or comment of your own.

title: Kibbles 'n Bites
descriptionFull: This API, co-developed two other bootcamp students, shows a restaurant menu in the view with a procedurally generated category and product layout that is easily updatable, for example by a chef.
The Cartify gem/library is implemented to simulate the flow of placing an online order.

title: Rock-Paper-Scissors
descriptionFull: This application returns a calculated Body Mass Index (BMI), defined as the ratio of height to weight.
React components are used to organize form field inputs and display outputs, and modules perform client-side calculations.

title: React BMI Calculator
descriptionFull: This application returns a calculated Body Mass Index (BMI), defined as the ratio of height to weight.
React components are used to organize form field inputs and display outputs, and modules perform client-side calculations.

tech.Client-side: React, NPM, HTML5, CSS3, Cypress, Enzyme

title: Address Book
descriptionFull: The Address Book application implements styles from a content delivery network (CDN) and using session storage in the browser to enable CRUD functionality.
